alert.note: Alert for Glades (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 28 at 7:48AM EDT until further notice by NWS Miami
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Miami FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Florida... Fisheating Creek near Palmdale affecting Glades County. For the Lake Okeechobee/Fisheating Creek...including Ortona Lock, 12 midnight avg lake lvl, Moore Haven Lock, Fisheating Creek near Lakeport at Highway 78, Clewiston Ind. Canal, Palmdale...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Fisheating Creek near Palmdale. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, The water begins enter from inside the main office and store in the campground. The Upstream campground and access roads to the campground are still completely flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 6.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening and continue rising to a crest of 7.8 feet early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.8 feet on 03/27/1970. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Fisheating Creek Palmdale 7.0 6.6 Wed 7 am EDT 7.4 7.8 7.7 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. This warning will be in effect until the river falls below its flood stage. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 745 PM EDT.
